p: Moreover, the total phytosterol contents were the highest in the SF-CO 2 extracted EDS oil, followed by Soxhlet-extracted and Cold-pressed EDS oil, which were all higher than that in olive oil (144 mg/100 g) [ 25], coconut oil (114 mg/100 g) [ 26] and walnut oil (160 mg/100 g) [ 27]. The same trend was also found in the extraction of grape seed oils [ 28]. Many research results have shown that phytosterols can decrease the serum cholesterol levels in human body [ 29]. Therefore, the high levels of phytosterols in EDS oils implied that it could be used as healthy edible oils or developed as functional food ingredients.
